snippet: Months after the massacre of 26 people at a school in Newtown, Conn., legislative leaders announced what they called the most far-reaching gun-legislation package in the country.
abstract: Connecticut state legislators announce agreement on what they call most far-reaching gun-legislation package in nation, three months after Newtown massacre; among provisions, law would require new state-issued eligibility certificates for the purchase of any rifle, shotgun or ammunition, universal background checks for the sale of all firearms; and substantial expansion of state’s existing ban on assault weapons.

byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz and Thomas Kaplan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Months after the massacre of 26 people at a school in Newtown, Conn., legislative leaders announced what they called the most far-reaching gun-legislation package in the country.

headline.main: Legislators in Connecticut Agree on Broad New Gun Laws
headline.print_headline: Connecticut’s Legislators Agree On Sweeping Gun-Control Laws
